snippet: Some foreign policy experts hope Fan Jinghui's capture will prompt Beijing to consider sending military resources to the Middle East to help reclaim territory held by Islamic militants.
abstract: Capture of Fan Jinghui, first Chinese citizen known to have been kidnapped by Islamic State, is increasing pressure on China to more vigorously challenge spread of Islamic extremism in Middle East.

byline.contributor: Vanessa Piao contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Some foreign policy experts hope Fan Jinghui's capture will prompt Beijing to consider sending military resources to the Middle East to help reclaim territory held by Islamic militants.

headline.main: Chinese Citizen Held by ISIS Poses Test for Beijing
headline.print_headline: Chinese Citizen Held by ISIS Has Beijing at a Mideast Crossroads

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
